Add a space after :? SO when we append it we can read a little easier
Example:
OneSignal is shareLocation enabled: true
instead
OneSignal is shareLocation enabled:true
Is there a reason we used Boolean class instead of primitive for locationShared and requiresUserPrivacyConsent?
good catch, this was because on the first iteration I was initializing as null
Do we need the responseJson.has(LOCATION_SHARED) check? Doesnt optBoolean do that internally?
yup, if the value doesn't exist it will end on the fallback
Do we need the responseJson.has(REQUIRES_USER_PRIVACY_CONSENT) check? Doesnt optBoolean do that internally?
yup, if the value doesn't exist it will end on the fallback
Why did we change this app_id? Just curious
Because we have a check for this id on the initializationChecker under the init method on OneSignal.java and we don't want to test under that condition
Should we construct a JSONObject and use toString method instead of hardcoding this?

Its a mocked hardcoded response for testing, from my point of view, is easier to read in this way since there is a lot of data. But if you prefer to have it as a JsonObject yeah that wouldn't harm, let me know

ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext() is okay to set context with also and it will be more consistent with our other UnitTests. However, I think we should call this inside of the UnitTests individually so its easier to understand that this is an important part of the new OneSignal init
Maybe we should still pass in a boolean param so it's easier it read? I saw this always sets it true
new line OneSignalInit(); this
Removed redundant if outside of synchronized
actually this was discussed on #1092 (comment)

Integer.MAX_VALUE seems a bit aggressive maybe we should just do -1?

Okay Integer.MAX_VALUE is fine then haha
